title: Sean Paul McCabe in Ibiza hospital after diving into pool and breaking back
text:
365 shares 213
View
comments
A young British holidaymaker is in intensive care in Ibiza after he jumped head first into a swimming pool and broke his back in two places.
Sean Paul McCabe, 20, was on his first holiday abroad when he dived into the shallow end of the pool the day after a night of partying with friends, and now faces an agonising wait for crucial surgery to repair his broken spine.
The Belfast man, whose family has flown to the Spanish island to be by his side, must wait to have the operation as he did not buy travel insurance when he booked the last-minute trip, his worried parents said.
Sean Paul McCabe is in intensive care in Ibiza after he jumped head first into the shallow end of a pool
Mr McCabe, a plumber and father of a two-year-old boy, joined his friends on the trip at the last minute
A doctor told his parents he was ‘minutes away’ from being paralysed due to the swelling around his spine, had he not received medical care in time.
His mother, Edith, told Belfast Live : ‘Every day is critical at the moment because the break is so close to his heart, so the bones could slip and go into the heart.

Share this article Share 365 shares ‘If he had insurance he would get the operation straight away but because he has no insurance we are waiting for documentation from the embassy to say the treatment will be paid for.’
With Mr McCabe facing a lengthy stay in a hospital in the town of San Antonio, his family has set up an online campaign to raise enough funds to allow them to remain by his side.
Mr McCabe's mother, Edith, said she didn't want her son to travel to Ibiza due to its notorious party scene
So far they have raised more than £4,500 to cover the cost of accommodation.
Mr McCabe, a plumber and father of a two-year-old boy, suffered the serious injury last Wednesday, three days after he arrived in Ibiza.
He travelled to the island at the last minute after a friend pulled out of the trip, even though his mother didn’t want him to go due to its notorious reputation.
She said: ‘The nightclub Sean Paul and his friends were at the night before the accident stayed open until 7am and I think he was so tired when he jumped in the pool that he didn’t realise it was the shallow end.’
The incident occurred just weeks following the death of 21-year-old holidaymaker Alan Drennan, from Newtownabbey, near Belfast.
He was found dead in his Ibiza hotel room after he was removed from his flight and allegedly assaulted by Spanish police officers.
The Police Service of Northern Ireland have launched an investigation into the man's death.
